trans-unit.source: The JOIN operations, which are among the possible tableExpressions in a FROM clause, perform joins between two tables. (You can also perform a join between two tables using an explicit equality test in a WHERE clause, such as WHERE t1.col1 = t2.col2.)

seg-source.mrk: The JOIN operations, which are among the possible tableExpressions in a FROM clause, perform joins between two tables.
(You can also perform a join between two tables using an explicit equality test in a WHERE clause, such as <codeph>WHERE t1.col1 = t2.col2</codeph>.)

target.mrk: The JOIN operations, which are among the possible tableExpressions in a FROM clause, perform joins between two tables.
(You can also perform a join between two tables using an explicit equality test in a WHERE clause, such as <codeph>WHERE t1.col1 = t2.col2</codeph>.)

trans-unit.source: Specifies a join between two tables with an explicit join clause.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies a join between two tables with an explicit join clause.

target.mrk: Specifies a join between two tables with an explicit join clause.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a join between two tables with an explicit join clause, preserving unmatched rows from the first table.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies a join between two tables with an explicit join clause, preserving unmatched rows from the first table.

target.mrk: Specifies a join between two tables with an explicit join clause, preserving unmatched rows from the first table.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a join between two tables with an explicit join clause, preserving unmatched rows from the second table.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies a join between two tables with an explicit join clause, preserving unmatched rows from the second table.

target.mrk: Specifies a join between two tables with an explicit join clause, preserving unmatched rows from the second table.

trans-unit.source: Specifies a join that produces the Cartesian product of two tables. It has no explicit join clause.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies a join that produces the Cartesian product of two tables.
It has no explicit join clause.

target.mrk: Specifies a join that produces the Cartesian product of two tables.
It has no explicit join clause.

trans-unit.source: Specifies an inner or outer join between two tables. It has no explicit join clause. Instead, one is created implicitly using the common columns from the two tables.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies an inner or outer join between two tables.
It has no explicit join clause.
Instead, one is created implicitly using the common columns from the two tables.

target.mrk: Specifies an inner or outer join between two tables.
It has no explicit join clause.
Instead, one is created implicitly using the common columns from the two tables.

trans-unit.source: In all cases, you can specify additional restrictions on one or both of the tables being joined in outer join clauses or in the <xref href="rrefsqlj33602.dita#rrefsqlj33602">WHERE clause</xref>.

seg-source.mrk: In all cases, you can specify additional restrictions on one or both of the tables being joined in outer join clauses or in the <xref href="rrefsqlj33602.dita#rrefsqlj33602">WHERE clause</xref>.

target.mrk: In all cases, you can specify additional restrictions on one or both of the tables being joined in outer join clauses or in the <xref href="rrefsqlj33602.dita#rrefsqlj33602">WHERE clause</xref>.

trans-unit.source: For information on which types of joins are optimized, see <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph></cite>.

seg-source.mrk: For information on which types of joins are optimized, see <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph></cite>.

target.mrk: For information on which types of joins are optimized, see <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/cittuning"></ph></cite>.
